item.ptxt: Use the same procedures for the RH side and LH side.
The procedures listed below are for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT SPEED SENSOR LH (w/ ABS)

s2.ptxt: Detach the 2 clamps and the connector.
Detach the clamp and remove the bolt and harness clamp.
Remove the bolt and harness clamp.
Remove the 3 bolts, 2 harness clamps and speed sensor.

atten3.ptxt: Keep the sensor tip and sensor installation hole free from foreign matter.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT FRONT LOWER SUSPENSION ARM SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Install the hub nuts to the disc.
Using a dial indicator, measure the lower ball joint for excessive play when you push the hub nuts up and down with a force of 294 N (30 kgf, 66 lbf).

item.ptxt: If the joint play is not as specified, replace the lower arm sub-assembly.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT FRONT SHOCK ABSORBER WITH COIL SPRING

atten4.ptxt: While fixing the nut in place, loosen and remove the bolt.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the shock absorber with coil spring from the lower arm.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT FRONT STABILIZER LINK ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut and disconnect the stabilizer link from the lower arm.

atten4.ptxt: If the ball joint turns together with the nut, use a 6 mm hexagon wrench to hold the stud in place.

s2.ptxt: Using SST, remove the front spring bumper.

atten3.ptxt: Rotate SST in the direction shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT LOWER SUSPENSION ARM SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 bolts, and disconnect the ball joint attachment from the steering knuckle.
Place matchmarks on the No. 1 camber adjusting cam and vehicle frame.
Remove the 2 nuts, No. 1 and No. 2 camber adjusting cams, 2 camber adjusting cams and lower arm.
